meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Ross Belsome Virginia Cummings Josh Hill Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7770.

td.p: Ross Belsome, a valuation analyst from Houston, Texas
Virginia Cummings, a geriatrician from Randolph, Massachusetts
Josh Hill, a network engineer from North Little Rock, Arkansas (whose 7-day cash winnings total $163,721)

tr.td: (Alex: As they celebrate their 102nd running this Sunday.)
BALKAN NATIONS
"ZZ" MIDDLE
(Alex: Two "Z"s coming up in the middle of each correct response.)
SIGNS & GESTURES
GENIUSES ARE BORN
NOT MADE

toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Al Unser Jr.

Ross
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In 1992, five years after his father won, this junior guy, Little Al, won the race by its closest margin, less than a car length')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In 1992, five years after his father won, this junior guy, Little Al, won the race by its closest margin, less than a car length

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows an image of the hand of benediction.) The hand of benediction, with the ring and pinky fingers folded in, has been used by the Roman Catholic church since the start; some doctors have suggested that it was actually a sign of nerve damage of this first pope & copied by later popes')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows an image of the hand of benediction.) The hand of benediction, with the ring and pinky fingers folded in, has been used by the Roman Catholic church since the start; some doctors have suggested that it was actually a sign of nerve damage of this first pope & copied by later popes

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
